Descriptions: A unique identification number for a request. The same number will show in the response for this request.
Tracking ID
Expected delivery date
Expected Delivery Time
Guaranteed Delivery Date – Global Express Mail only: certain countries provide a guarantee delivery For Example: April 15, 2020 Or 3 Business Days
Summary of the status of the shipment, ie In-Transit, Delivered, etc. For example: February 5 7:28 pm ENROUTE 33699
Scan statuses from points in transit.
API=TrackV2
This attribute specifies your Web Tools ID. See the Developers Guide for information on obtaining your USERID. For Example: <USERID=”XXXXXXXXXXXX”>

This is for versioning of the API's and for triggering response tags for future versions. In this API use a value of 1 to return all available response tags and trigger new functionality. For example: <Revision>1</Revision>
User IP address. Required when TrackFieldRequest[Revision='1']. For example: <ClientIp>137.0.0.1</ClientIp>
External integrators should pass company name. For example: <SourceId>XYZ Corp</SourceId>
Package Tracking ID. Must be alphanumeric characters. For example: <TrackID ID="EJ123456780US"></TrackID>
5 digit destination zip code. For example: <DestinationZipCode>12345</DestinationZipCode>
Mailing date of package. Format: YYYY-MM-DD For example: <MailingDate>2010-01-01</MailingDate>
Package Tracking ID number.
Guaranteed Delivery Date – Global Express Mail only: certain countries provide a guarantee delivery.
Signifies if the mail piece is eSOF eligible.

The time of the event.
The date of the event.
The event type (e.g., Enroute).

The reason code

A unique identification number for a request. The same number that was provided in the request. For example: 122
The tracking number ID submitted through the request For example: EA123456795US 12887393000019
Additional package information
Additional ADP scripting specific to the ADP Type code
Information regarding availability of Restore service function For example Yes
Additional Label on the mail piece For example: EA123456785US This is not currently populated.
True/False field indicating the item qualifies for the customer to electronically authorize shipment release.
Mail Class of the mail piece (human readable). This will also include the service standard message if it exists. No Default of False.
Mail Class of the mail piece (code). For example:EX, PM, CP, IP
The destination city. For example: Rochester
The destination country code. For example:MX, CA
The destination State. For example: NY
The destination ZIP code. For example:20024
Edited Label ID or Full Label ID. Used only when Source ID is IVR For example:EA123456795US
Signifies if USPS Tracking by Email service is enabled.

Occurs: Optional, used only when end of day condition is met
Descriptions: Populated with the end of day time provided by TRP when TRP API indicates the window is “End of Day” or when the piece is eligible for the PTR default end of day. For example: by 5:00pm Note: an end of day scenario occurs when the TRP API response indicates a 0 length window.
Signifies if the mailpiece is eSOF eligibile.
Expected delivery date. For example:December 31, 2013
Expected Delivery Time. For example: 3:00 PM
Populates “Expected Delivery by” if there is an EDD. For example: Expected Delivery by
Guaranteed Delivery Date – Global Express Mail only: certain countries provide a guarantee delivery. For example: April 15, 2011 or 3 Business Days
Guaranteed Delivery Time provided for Priority Mail Express. For example: 3:00 PM
Populates “Scheduled Delivery by” if there is a GDD. For example: Scheduled Delivery by
Special messaging related to the guarantee. For example: “Loss Only Guarantee”
Indicates the shape of the item.
Internal date stamp.
Field indicating if the item will be delivered on time as specified in the Expected or Guaranteed delivery date.
The origin city.
The origin country code.
The origin state.
The origin ZIP code.
Signifies if Proof of Delivery service is enabled.
Predicted delivery date. December 30, 2013
Predicted Delivery Time 3:00 PM or blank.

Populates “Expected Delivery ‘by or on’”, if the source of the PDD is TRP API. Populates “Expected Delivery on” if the source of the PDD is a PTR calculated date. For example: Expected Delivery by or Expected Delivery on
States which system provided the Predicted Delivery prediction. TRP, AA
Predicted Delivery Window start time in am/pm format. In an EndOfDay scenario, the PDWStart tag is null. 11:00am For example: (null)
Predicted Delivery Window end time in am/pm format. In an EndOfDay scenario, the PDWEnd tag is null. 1:00pm For example: (null)
Contains the Purge By Date of the mail piece. Example: December 31, 2024

The related label ID between a tracking barcode, the core product, and a PS3811, Green Card Return Reciept. This field can contain either the core product label ID or the Green Card label ID. There is only a one to one relationship. Core Product ID: EA123456795US Or Green Card ID; 9590940112345671234567
Field indicating if the item qualifies for redelivery.
Signifies if Restore tracking information service is enabled Values:
Field indicating the date the item will be Returned to Sender.
Signifies if Proof of Delivery service is enabled
Signifies if Tracking Proof of Delivery service is enabled
Signifies if RRAM service is enabled
Signifies if Return Receipt Electronic service is enabled
Additional services purchased
Service Type Code of the mail piece M, AD, VI, 03, 70, 716
For example: Delivered
For example: In Transit
Status summary For example: Your item was delivered at 12:55 pm on April 05, 2010 in FALMOUTH, MA 02540
Internal description of mail piece as it relates to PTR (live, history, or archived piece) T, H, A (CMC830 V3 – T is the only value defined)
Value of Article for when the Source ID is PIN

Used to provide additional information regarding an event posted to a mail piece.
The time of the event.
The date of the event.
The event type.
The city where the event occurred.

Descriptions of error message. Duplicate or 4 items were also tied to your 3849 ID but exceeded the maximum number of tracking number inquiries supported on this site. This 3849 ID was used on a large volume shipment and cannot be used for tracking on this site.
API=PTSEmail.
This attribute specifies your Web Tools ID. See the Developers Guide for information on obtaining your USERID. For Example: <USERID=”XXXXXXXXXXXX”>
Must be alphanumeric characters. For example: <TrackId>EJ123456780US</TrackId>
User IP address. For example: <ClientIp>127.0.0.0</ClientIp>
Internal User Identification. For example: <SourceId>XYZ Corp</SourceId>
MPSUFFIX value located in Track/Confirm Fields API response data. Unique to each TrackID. For example: <MpSuffix>9402</MpSuffix>
MPDATE value located in Track/Confirm Fields API response data. Unique to each TrackId. For example: <MpDate>2009-07-02 00:42:23.35744</MpDate>

Enter a notification request type from the choices available. Request Type Descriptions “AL” E-Mail Alert “FD” E-Mail Future Delivery “ED” E-Mail Delivery/Non Delivery activity “TD” E-Mail Today Delivery “UP” E-Mail Available for Pickup “FS” Package addressed to me/myusps only “OA” Other Activity For example: <RequestType>ED</RequestType>
Validation: minOccurs="1" maxOccurs =”5” Enumerations= · AL · FD · ED · TD · UP · FS · OA

Descriptions: Recipient First Name. For example: <FirstName>John</FirstName>
Recipient Last Name. For example: <LastName>Doe</LastName>
Complete valid e-mail address is Required if tag is used. For example: <Email1>cpapple@email.com</Email1>
Complete valid e-mail address is Required if tag is used.
Complete valid e-mail address is Required if tag is used.
